snippet: More than a quarter of the field at last month’s British Open, including the winner, Ernie Els, used a nontraditional putter.
abstract: Two of the three majors this year were won by golfers wielding nontraditional putters, renewing the debate on whether the Royal & Ancient and the United States Golf Assn should ban them.
lead_paragraph: More than a quarter of the field at last month’s British Open, including the winner, Ernie Els, used a nontraditional putter.

headline.seo: On the Putting Green, Long and Short Putters Prompt Endless Discussion
headline.main: Pros Line Up to Debate Use of Long Putters
headline.print_headline: Pros Line Up to Debate Use of Long Putters
